channel.title: oliSUNvia
channel.description:
a mix of: philosophy, social science research, media & gen z trends trying to be: open-minded, empathetic, & critical
thank you if you've ever watched my videos, it means a lot!

item.title: your humor is inherently political.
item.description:
Get an exclusive 15% discount on Saily data plans! Use code olisunvia at checkout. Download Saily app or go to https://saily.com/olisunvia ⛵
Irony rules online humor. With irony, there is no such thing as being plain ol' "apolitical." Even when the content of a joke seems apolitical, the structure and function of irony itself is political.
✧･ﾟ: *✧･ﾟ:* i'd love to hear what you all have to say *:･ﾟ✧*:･ﾟ✧
TIMESTAMPS: 0:00 intro 1:11 Part I: Irony is... complicated 6:51 Part II: The elements of irony 7:37 Critical edge 9:11 Semantic complexity 14:05 Discursive communities 22:02 Part III: Irony in politics
★・・・・・★・・・・・★ If you want extra ways to support my channel and get more content, check out my PATREON: patreon.com/oliSUNvia
socials: ,, instagram: @olisunvia ,, spotify: liv sun
EDITOR: @daikohi and IG: @douglxs_m
FOR BUSINESS INQUIRIES: olisunvia@gmail.com
★・・・・・★・・・・・★ SOURCES: Hutcheon, Linda. (1994). Irony's Edge: The Theory and Politics of Irony. Galewski, Elizabeth. (2008). "Playing Up Being a Woman: 'Femme Performance and the Potential for Ironic' Representation." Rhetoric and Public Affairs, Vol. 11, No. 2. Levitt, Heidi M., Elisabeth A. Gerrish, & Katherine R. Hiestand. (2003). "The Misunderstood Gender: A Model of Modern Femme Identity." Sex Roles, Vol. 48, Nos. 3/4.
MUSIC: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xHbEBMrASvk https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FV-Rt_hTzaU https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fEby4RWdokQ https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WZoOFBbwx1A
★・・・・・★・・・・・★
